comment: As long as you do the work and put in effort you will be fine. He is a great teacher and he grades very fair. Gives multiple attempts at test, as long as you study you will pass. He has clear study material. Also very organized material and he gives good feedback.

Summer class. So easy, just do the work. Quizzes unlimited attempts. Exams 3 attempts, scores highest attempt. Exams are same questions from quizzes, but shuffles some of the questions. A good amount of homework, but doable. Group project, but broken up into smaller pieces. There's a presentation, but since this is online, it was voice recorded.
Overall just a really good professor who was very receptive to feedback.

As long as you complete all your work it's an easy A. He's is very caring and will help you if you are confused on anything. He has a strong accent but he does his best to make sure everyone is understanding what he is saying.
Do the work and you'll be fine. Great professor

Very cool professor! Not as understanding and considerate as I would've liked but that's any professor. Pretty easy as long as you do your work. Projects and assignments are pretty confusing and he expects you to assume a lot of info. Assignments weeks didn't assign with lectures. Easy A as long as you don't have a life outside of school :)

he is nice professor,
please email him with questions,
he is happy to answer your questions.
unlimited attempts in the quizzes
you have 3 attempts in the exams and he grades the highest grade
group project!
There will be excel projects as well, so be prepared to do them on time.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very accessible; always responds to emails, does in-class practices very similar to the actual assignments, mid-term and final same as quizzes and warm-up questions.

Exams are lockdown, quizzes arent. He does NOT go over the exam material during class, you will have to go over exam material on your own, lectures usually have nothing to do with the quizzes and exam. Other than that, he is pretty knowledgeable in his field, and goes over interesting things in class such as coding a webpage.

PLEASE take this class I went to a total of two in person classes and left the class with an A. Test and quizzes are online with no lockdown browser and open note and there a plenty of quizlets to help you out! He records how to do all projects so its mostly just following directions! Very easy grader just show effort and he will reward u for it!

He does have an accent, but I was able to understand him. He is a really nice and caring professor. He is very flexible and responds quickly on email. He does assign a lot of projects, and some can be a bit challenging, but he will give you a good grade if he sees you've tried. Overall, not a bad choice.

Heavy accent but he knows/works with you. A lot of assignments that are time consuming but he goes over them step by step in class to explain how to do each of them and how they are graded. Only had two tests including the final (online and open note but time restraint). Grade mostly comes from weekly assign and quizes. easily reached by email.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Pretty good professor and easy class. There is a lot of work but if you spread it out, you should be able to get all of it done by the due dates pretty easily. Lectures are posted online if you miss class. Midterm and final are open note and very easy along with all quizzes. 3D printing assignment was really cool.
All around amazing professor. Not too much homework, his communication is very clear, and his grading is fair. Attendance is not mandatory. You will not regret taking this class!

He is a really good teacher, he will show you how to do all the assignments in class, and he as well posts his lectures online if you miss his class. You have 5 big assignments and 15 quizzes. The quizzes are all open so you can go at your pace and finish ahead. Just be ahead on your work and this class will be super easy for you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a decent professor and knowledgeable in the subject. However, unless he was showing us how to do an assignment, the class was pointless to go to. Due dates are Thursdays at 10 pm instead of the beginning or end of the week at 11:59 pm like every other class which doesn't really make any sense. Pretty easy course if you do the work though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Be prepared for the test because they are really hard!!

Sooo happy I took this professor! He was extremely helpful in explaining every project in DETAIL during class time. Projects werent hard since he helped so much! Final project isnt difficult, just takes time to do with your group. Midterm and final were super easy and from the textbook so it wasnt difficult to study for! Take him!!

Overall easy class and the professor was good, however it was hard to understand him at times which is not his fault at all, just something to consider before taking his class. Class was almost completely based off of the textbook, so going to the lectures felt pointless unless he was showing you how to do an assignment. Open book tests/quizzes.

Dr. Shin is a very caring professor but his course online is strenuous. We had 5 big assignments, which included using Excel and coding a webpage resume. We had about 13 quizzes as well. If you decide to take this class online, I would highly suggest putting all of your assignments and due dates on a calendar so you don't get overwhelmed.

First things first - he has a heavy accent, so be prepared to decipher. Dr. Shin wants you to succeed and is very thorough with his work and examples. It is an easy class, especially for those who are familiar with computers and Office programs. Be prepared to take many quizzes and 4-5 assignments. Quizzes are open book/notes.
Save yourself and don't take this man.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Awesome professor. He truly wants everyone to succeed and is very understanding. I would highly recommend him.
